issue.title: will the NeckTrajectory function be fixed?

content.raw:
I'm running trajectory tests on the neck and publishing through the console with command:

```
#!

rostopic pub /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/neck_trajectory ihmc_msgs/NeckTrajectoryRosMessage '{joint_trajectory_messages: [{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.01, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]},{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.0, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]},{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.0, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]}], unique_id: 1}'
```
Results in this error:
```
#!

[ERROR] [1486726549.250592385, 27.625000000]: Exception in thread "SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController-thread-1" java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: tried to cap a value 0.0 between a min of 0.0 and a max of -0.1. The max value is less than or equal to the min value
[ERROR] [1486726549.251104968, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.DRCControllerThread.run(DRCControllerThread.java:360)
[ERROR] [1486726549.251265208, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.concurrent.SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController$ReentrantLockedControlElementRunner.run(SynchronousMultiThreadedRobotController.java:89)
[ERROR] [1486726549.251947802, 27.625000000]: 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
[ERROR] [1486726549.252543922, 27.625000000]: Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: tried to cap a value 0.0 between a min of 0.0 and a max of -0.1. The max value is less than or equal to the min value
[ERROR] [1486726549.252693525, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.MathTools.clipToMinMax(MathTools.java:227)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253040342, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.math.trajectories.PolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.compute(PolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.java:50)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253271720, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.math.trajectories.CubicPolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.compute(CubicPolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.java:39)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253474886, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.math.trajectories.PolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.initialize(PolynomialTrajectoryGenerator.java:42)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253645216, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.math.trajectories.waypoints.MultipleWaypointsTrajectoryGenerator.initializeSubTrajectory(MultipleWaypointsTrajectoryGenerator.java:174)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253788768, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.math.trajectories.waypoints.MultipleWaypointsTrajectoryGenerator.compute(MultipleWaypointsTrajectoryGenerator.java:186)
[ERROR] [1486726549.253929907, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controlModules.head.JointspaceHeadControlState.doAction(JointspaceHeadControlState.java:103)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254069216, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.stateMachines.GenericStateMachine.doAction(GenericStateMachine.java:152)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254209877, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.controlModules.head.HeadOrientationManager.compute(HeadOrientationManager.java:159)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254361899, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.highLevelHumanoidControl.highLevelStates.WalkingHighLevelHumanoidController.updateManagers(WalkingHighLevelHumanoidController.java:596)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254505143, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.highLevelHumanoidControl.highLevelStates.WalkingHighLevelHumanoidController.doAction(WalkingHighLevelHumanoidController.java:521)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254680982, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.robotics.stateMachines.GenericStateMachine.doAction(GenericStateMachine.java:152)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254826144, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.commonWalkingControlModules.highLevelHumanoidControl.HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.doControl(HighLevelHumanoidControllerManager.java:178)
[ERROR] [1486726549.254946228, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.simulationconstructionset.robotController.ModularRobotController.doControl(ModularRobotController.java:20)
[ERROR] [1486726549.255089152, 27.625000000]: 	at us.ihmc.wholeBodyController.DRCControllerThread.run(DRCControllerThread.java:352)
[ERROR] [1486726549.255229463, 27.625000000]: 	... 2 more

```
I really just want an update on the status of this fix. It seems that the min and max values for this are reversed. It results in Valkyrie performing backward somersaults.

I'm running trajectory tests on the neck and publishing through the console with command:

rostopic pub /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/neck_trajectory ihmc_msgs/NeckTrajectoryRosMessage '{joint_trajectory_messages: [{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.01, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]},{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.0, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]},{trajectory_points: [time: 0.1, position: 0.0, velocity: 0.0, unique_id: 1]}], unique_id: 1}'

issue.title: will the NeckTrajectory function be fixed?

content.raw: The NeckTrajectory should now be functional in the 0.8.2 release of the valkyrie controller, which has been uploaded as valkyrie_controller.tar.gz (see also #72). Can you try downloading the controller tarball again?
content.html: The NeckTrajectory should now be functional in the 0.8.2 release of the valkyrie controller, which has been uploaded as valkyrie_controller.tar.gz (see also #72). Can you try downloading the controller tarball again?

issue.title: will the NeckTrajectory function be fixed?

content.raw: I believe this is resolved; please re-open if the issue persists
content.html: I believe this is resolved; please re-open if the issue persists

issue.title: will the NeckTrajectory function be fixed?

content.raw:
@scpeters, I tried downloading the updated valkyrie_controller.tar.gz to fix the neck control but after re-building the controller I started getting the error:

```
us.ihmc.valkyrieRosControl.ValkyrieRosControlController does not extend us.ihmc.rosControl.wholeRobot.IHMCWholeRobotControlJavaBridge
```
and Val would collapse.  I couldn't get it to work again until I replaced it with the old controller:  
http://gazebosim.org/distributions/srcsim/valkyrie_controller.0.8.1.tar.gz
and re-ran steps 11 & 13 from the system-setup tutorial.  Of course that means that the neck trajectories still wouldn't work.  

Any suggestions for avoiding the error above?  Hopefully I just missed a step.
content.html:
@scpeters, I tried downloading the updated valkyrie_controller.tar.gz to fix the neck control but after re-building the controller I started getting the error:

us.ihmc.valkyrieRosControl.ValkyrieRosControlController does not extend us.ihmc.rosControl.wholeRobot.IHMCWholeRobotControlJavaBridge

and Val would collapse. I couldn't get it to work again until I replaced it with the old controller:
http://gazebosim.org/distributions/srcsim/valkyrie_controller.0.8.1.tar.gz and re-ran steps 11 & 13 from the system-setup tutorial. Of course that means that the neck trajectories still wouldn't work.

Any suggestions for avoiding the error above? Hopefully I just missed a step.
